website_summaries.verdict: Splint helps ease pain by keeping ankle in proper place all night. Excellent build quality.
pros: Extremely rigid design versus some other products – provides excellent support
Skid-proof strips on the bottom for steady footing
More comfortable to wear than it looks
cons: Velcro strips don't last long because of design
Some say straps dig into the skin, causing discomfort

customer_reviews.title: It works great to relieve your pain but the velcro wears out ...
customer_reviews.text: Product is ok. It works great to relieve your pain but the velcro wears out quick. After about two months of every day use, the velcro will barely stick. The upper and middle velcros, you won't have a problem since you still have the snaps to keep the velcro in place. The problem is the bottom velcro where you don't have the extra snaps, so if your velcro won't stick, you have a loose fitting splint in the bottom. It still works but at least for me, it feels uncomfortable when I sleep w/ it at night.
customer_reviews.author: Andrei

customer_reviews.title: Perfect splint that relieves pain
customer_reviews.text: I tried several other types of splints before coming across this one. it works perfect for me. Stays in place at night when I sleep and lightweight enough that it doesn't bother me at night. I can walk to the bathroom or a short distance in the house while wearing it. However the Velcro did wear out after a few months and I just added new Velcro strips. the buckles do help keep the boot in place as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nursemerry

customer_reviews.title: Great product great price
customer_reviews.text: I've bought many boots and this one is the best so far and somehow the cheapest. Very comfortable. Doesn't make me wake up in the night from discomfort from something digging in to deep. Lots of padding. Keeps foot in perfect position. Clasps keep closed. The ice pack is a great addition but I wish it lasted longer. I put a wet sponge in a Ziploc and freeze it and use that in place of the ice pack if I don't fall asleep before it defrosts. The sponge lasts a lot longer. The boot is great though
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: If You Need It, This is the One
customer_reviews.text: I think that if you need to wear one of these, this model is a good one. It is comfortable to wear all night, and includes an ice pad that can be used in conjunction, an excellent method of applying ice therapy and allows one to keep the foot to maintain a 90 angle simultaneously. I wear a size 13 shoe and the largest size has my toes sticking out. This has not reduced the effectiveness of this device. The liner is removable and washable. I use mine during the day as well to keep the PF in a relaxed position as often as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Solovino

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but would not stay in place while sleeping!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size small/medium as I take a women's size 8 shoe. It was very comfortable but unfortunately I would wake up all night as my foot kept slipping out. I couldn't keep my foot correctly aligned in the boot for it to be effective.. As for the cold pack, I didn't think it was effective as it didn't get cold enough and warmed up really quickly and wasn't comfortable in the boot. If they made it without the cold pack I think the boot would have fit much better..
customer_reviews.author: Hotpink

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and effective with a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a ladies 11M shoe and ordered the L/XL. The brace is very comfortable but could hold a wider and/or longer foot. The 3 loop fasteners make the soft lining totally adjustable. The nylon straps are great because I did not manage to get the brace off in the middle of the night as I did with a sock-type support. I would recommend to others and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Bert

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and effective
customer_reviews.text: After trying several night splints for relief from a heel spur I ended up keeping this one - it is the most comfortable. Dorsiflexion straps on other splints kept getting wrapped up in my bed sheets. 4 stars instead of 5 because the velcro fasteners are insufficient (stopped working after about a month of regular wear). I had a seamstress add more velcro to all of the straps and now they stay fastened throughout the night.
customer_reviews.author: lisa4140

customer_reviews.title: but I ultimately found it was bulky and comfortable enough that it impaired my sleep
customer_reviews.text: I have short arms and live alone--it was VERY difficult to put this on. It did relieve my pain, but I ultimately found it was bulky and comfortable enough that it impaired my sleep. Am trying the Strassburg sock.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, premature wear of padding
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to, and my husband has noticed improvement since using this. Finds he can't go without now. The main complaint is that you get what you pay for. Picked this one bc it was cheap, but the padding is already wearing out. He has been using it for about 2 months. All you do is wear it while you are sleeping, so it doesn't seem like there should be so much wear already. But it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: marilyn

customer_reviews.title: ... a few different braces and these are the most comfortable and effective that I've had
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few different braces and these are the most comfortable and effective that I've had. On other braces I've found that the velcro tends to lose effectiveness over time, so the additional straps on this one are a nice feature that helps to keep a secure fit for longer.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Rose

customer_reviews.title: would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Best brace used so far. A little bulky but they do make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mello

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This boot has helped my Plantar fasciitis tremendously! It makes walking first thing in the morning much more tolerable. It took a couple of nights to get used to sleeping with it on. I love the soft insert that you can freeze to help with inflammation. highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M. Childers

customer_reviews.title: Relief!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing this night splint for two weeks and it seems to be helping with my plantar fasciitis already. It is comfortable and easy to adjust. It's especially soothing when using the included ice pack. I only wish the ice came in a 2-pack and had a bit of arch support at the center.
customer_reviews.author: Wrestling woman

customer_reviews.title: I bought it to relieve heel pain. Wore it ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to relieve heel pain.Wore it for two hours one night. Couldn't walk without tremendous achilles tendon pain for the next 3 days. The back of the unit is curved to match the curvature of the achilles however when you snug the straps to fit your heel to the rear that curvature presses on the achilles too tight.
customer_reviews.author: thebuyingpublic

customer_reviews.title: Walking normal again!
customer_reviews.text: I love this night split. It is very comfortable and easy to use. I have had severe chronic achilles tendonitis for years, this boot and ASTYM therapy has returned my life to normal. It is such a relief to wake up in the morning and be able to walk! The gentle stretch while sleeping keeps the tendon lengthed so in the morning there is no struggle stretching it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Girl

customer_reviews.title: Used for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: Great at 1st. Then the inner material started falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice fit- love the gel pack
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice night splint. I really like the removable gel pack. It really helps on the nights my Achilles tendon feels like it is on fire. The chill pack stays cool long enough for me to fall asleep. I like that it never feels moist. The boot itself is easy to adjust for size and personal fitting comfort. It isn't super easy to walk in but that's the trade off for being able to sleep comfortably with a big ol boot on ya foot :)
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Cullen

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love! I actually woke up the first morning and could walk and not hobble to the bathroom. I have been using it for about 2 weeks now and can tell a difference. My only complaint is I wish the straps were a little longer because I have big ankles and calves.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality Velcro.
customer_reviews.text: The Velcro that is supposed to keep the lining in place within the hard boot doesn’t work after a few wearing. Poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is the second splint I've purchased in three months. My initial purchase, Bird & Cronin Night Splint was a disaster. Manufacturers are using material which will adhere to a Velcro patch. Unfortunately, the material wears out quickly and sections of the splint open at night. The Brownmed Nice Stretch 90 included the same Velcro to material attachment, however the company went the extra step of including adjustable straps which keep the splint in position and prevents wear on the padded material. Now, if they would just include an adjustable strap on the lower foot/toe section they'd have a WINNER! Plantar fasciitis takes MONTHS to fully heal and this product should do the job.
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnn Herbst

customer_reviews.title: Although I did not use this product for any real ...
customer_reviews.text: Although I did not use this product for any real length of time, I did not notice any difference in the pain I was going through after using it for a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Curt N.

customer_reviews.title: Not every case of Plantar Fasciitis will respond to night splints
customer_reviews.text: I found this boot takes less strap tension than the soft, sock types, and thus is less likely, on my feet, to numbness and discomfort. The buckle on the upper strap is badly worked out, and loosens immediately. Yes, it's clunky, but I haven't found it too uncomfortable, and can sleep fine and get up in the middle of the night to pee without trouble.
customer_reviews.author: R. Young

customer_reviews.title: thumbs up to these
customer_reviews.text: wonderful!!! At first it was awkward having two of these on my feet under the covers in bed. You get used to it. The cold packs feel absolutely wonderful and the angle is just right so that I am not hobbling around in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: missITXX

customer_reviews.title: The splint is well constructed. The only reason that ...
customer_reviews.text: The splint is well constructed. The only reason that I didn't give it a five star is that it has the tendency to be slightly tight around my calf and ankle.
customer_reviews.author: B ROB

customer_reviews.title: my foot definitely feels much better in the morning after wearing the boot all nite
customer_reviews.text: works well, my foot definitely feels much better in the morning after wearing the boot all nite, velcro stay on, plus there are clips to secure it. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who has plantar fasciitis. It did take a couple of days, almost a week before I started feeling relief, but I will take that!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: sandra

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable...
customer_reviews.text: I've had a very severe, persistent case of Plantar Fasciitis that has lasted several months. I tried a dorsal night splint prior to this one. It was uncomfortable and made my toes fall asleep, causing me to have to remove it in the middle of the night. This one is so comfortable, I rarely notice it's on while I'm sleeping. My foot is slowly getting better, so I believe this splint is helping.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: While struggling with Plantar fasciitis for some time and going to physical therapy for months, I bought this splint to try at night. I was pleasantly surprised that after a few weeks with the night splint coupled with physical therapy and working out at the gym (restricted - not fully) I was much better. I also used it after ACL surgery. My calf and ankle swelled up really bad and I was unable to stand because of the pressure and tightness after laying down. By using the splint at night it kept my foot flexed and stretching making it easier and less painful to get up and walk.
customer_reviews.author: pinschers

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I only had Plantar Fascitis a little over two weeks. I wore it every night. If I was resting, I'd put it on for a couple of hours in he afternoon. It's a mazing. It seems to take the pain away whenever it is on. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Barb zagnoni

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: This works for me, but I sometimes take them off during the night because they get uncomfortable. Wearing socks helps.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: This is comfortable but could use some improvement
customer_reviews.text: It is nice to have the gel packs to slide in. I would like to see the straps longer for those of us with bigger calf muscles. Also, though they say you can walk in these (I assume for nighttime bathroom trips) it is very awkward. The gel packs need to be a little thicker gel (for more cooling and more comfort).
customer_reviews.author: Amtmatson

customer_reviews.title: Strange Heel design
customer_reviews.text: There is a ridge across the bottom of the heel which makes is very uncomfortable to walk even for a few steps to the bathroom at night. If you get up to go at night, you might want to try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: William Winter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value, $40 vs. the 200 the orthopedist was charging for a different but similar product. Comfortable to sleep in. The wrap is incredibly soft and comfortable. It really relieved the first step in the morning pain. The ice pack is good, but not great. Not cold enough and can't always get the cold near the spot I want it, but my pain was around the curve of my heel, not the bottom. Would probalby be fine on bottom, but still not very cold.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie La Scala

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Sleep with it every night, helped my foot pain, I love waking up in the morning and being able to put my foot on the ground without any pain
customer_reviews.author: Leonora

customer_reviews.title: Foot pain no more
customer_reviews.text: I am happy to say, after carefully picking which night brace I would select, I woke up after only the first night wearing the brace, with nearly no pain in my foot for the 1st time in nearly 1 year. Putting it on and taking off is a little cumbersome, but acceptable. As for comfort, after getting into a comfortable position I slept with no problem. I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Zakin

customer_reviews.title: Helps Plantar Fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I bought some other night splints first and they were no good at all. This one is of very high quality. The pads help to keep the bands tighter at night than I could with other night splints.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Alan Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t hold.
customer_reviews.text: Did not hold my foot at 90 degree angle through the night.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The first one I ordered worked great and had a great effect to make my heel ...
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered several night splints for my Plantar Fasciitis, The first one I ordered worked great and had a great effect to make my heel not hurt anymore. However, the Velcro gave out after about 3 months and wouldn't hold my foot tights. This one is the most comfortable so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle L Ford

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical, but it works well for me.
customer_reviews.text: I must admit, I was skeptical, but this split seems to work very well. I do not have to wear it every night, but when I do need to use it it helps a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Foodlaw

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this for people who suffer from the same thing
customer_reviews.text: This has helped me greatly in terms of managing my pain from PF. I highly recommend this for people who suffer from the same thing. I don't, however, sleep in it, because it is a bit bulky and awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Have been wearing it about month. It has definitely helped my heel pain. Size was perfect and no trouble with velco straps. It was a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: SGL

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Comfortable for Sleeping
customer_reviews.text: After trying several different night splints this one really works and is very comfortable to sleep in. And it’s really working to relieve my plantar fasciitis. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy M.

customer_reviews.title: Pain relief the first night!
customer_reviews.text: After quite a bit of on line research I made this purchase. The first night made a huge difference with my heel pain. I continue to use it as needed and have no difficulty sleeping. Easy to put on and remove. Wish I would have found it earlier!
customer_reviews.author: Susan D

customer_reviews.title: My wife ordered this because her Dr. said she ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife ordered this because her Dr. said she needed this to help her. She said that it helps her. Steve
customer_reviews.author: wild man

customer_reviews.title: medical night splint
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. Its has helped me sooo much that I used it when I dont need it... It works even better when you do morning and night time yoga (mild) stretches, especially downward dog.
customer_reviews.author: Fergie

customer_reviews.title: Nice Stretch 90 worked great
customer_reviews.text: I had a painful case of plantar fasciitis. I started wearing this every night when I slept and I immediately started noticing improvement. It holds your foot in the proper position for healing, but does so in a very subtle way. I am delighted with how it has helped my foot and enabled me to start running again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mirabile

customer_reviews.title: Plantar fasciitis ...help me
customer_reviews.text: Love the ice pack , I wear size 11 in women’s. This fits perfect
customer_reviews.author: Brick Walls

customer_reviews.title: Decent but not great
customer_reviews.text: The boot is reasonably comfortable and seems to be helping. That being said, two of the rubber traction strips fell off in a couple of days and overall I don't see this holding up all that long.
customer_reviews.author: G. Little

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: Where is the blackstrap shown in the picture that pulls you into more dorsiflexion?
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Solved my Plantar Fasciitis issues in ONE DAY!
customer_reviews.text: I was going to wait a while before writing this review, but I wanted to get the word out. I have used them for four nights now and each morning I have NO foot pain. I typically do a long walk in the mornings but I've turned that into a run because my feet are on my side now. These are durable, well made, surprisingly comfortable and don't interfere with sleep at all. If you have PF pain, you need these.
customer_reviews.author: NtotheC

customer_reviews.title: Works but falls apart
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome at night, and really helped a lot, but the Velcro is a very weak hold and the slip guards popped out of place the first time I got up to use the restroom overnight.
customer_reviews.author: KIZON

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, was not sure I was going to be ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, was not sure I was going to be able to wear this while sleeping but have no problems at all. I have not tried the cooling pack that comes with it yet because my foot has not gotten hot yet with this on.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Dotson

customer_reviews.title: Heel spur boot review
customer_reviews.text: A great product which has provided relief and I believe healing of the heel spur (Plantar Fasciitis) in less than a month of use. It is good for wearing while sleeping since it is lightweight and has no sharp edges which might tear bedding when you move around in the bed. One problem, however, is the velcro over the front of the foot - it doesn't hold throughout the night - it needs a strap and snap like the other 2 fasteners. I handle the problem by using masking tape to hold that fastener in place. A great value for the moderate cost.
customer_reviews.author: Ron R

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Effective
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Easy to walk when wearing. Light and comfortable. Works for achilles tendinitis.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: night splint
customer_reviews.text: I have already recommended it to others. It is helping. Thank you for your excellent produts. Thank you so much.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine C. Lambeth

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow around calf
customer_reviews.text: It helps me with my foot problem, but I cannot close top portion of boot since the plastic mold at the top of boot is too narrow for my calf. Plus the fabric velcro at the top is not long enough to close either. I just wear it with the bottom 2 portions closed. Anyone with calf muscles would not fit in this boot at the top...poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Paul

customer_reviews.title: awesome product. always wear it to bed when i ...
customer_reviews.text: awesome product.always wear it to bed when i feel my heel starting to act up and no woories of hurting so bad on it in the morning
customer_reviews.author: stephen

customer_reviews.title: The product is great, I just can't get my body to sleep ...
customer_reviews.text: The product is great, I just can't get my body to sleep through the entire night without removing it. While I am wearing it, I can feel the difference, but it is hard to get comfortable to sleep through the entire night wearing the boot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much better than my last boot
customer_reviews.text: comfortable (especially if put foam insole in it), easy on & off, Most importantly - it works! The velcro on toe strap tends to weaken some over time - but a minor thing to me.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson P. Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: I love this Night Splint
customer_reviews.text: I love this Night Splint. I usually wear after a long day and the removable pad makes it convenient to place already frozen. You can also adjust and add a rolled sock under the toes to give even a greater stretch to your foot. I even wear this to bed with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Yari

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this product for relief from plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis. From the 1st night I wore this boot I've felt relief. It's been months since I've had relief. I highly recommend this product for relief from plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Casillas

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this more because of its bulk, I didn't think I would end up wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Elmasian

customer_reviews.title: It worked great. After wearing it every night for a month
customer_reviews.text: It worked great. After wearing it every night for a month, my painful plantars fascitis is gone. I highly recommend it. It took some getting use to wearing while sleeping but I quickly adjusted. I did not wear it during the day.
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: This splint has done the job
customer_reviews.text: This splint has allowed me, along with other forms of therapy, to overcome my plantar fasciitis sufficiently to actually return to running on a limited basis. The only problem is that the Velcro straps to not last long, and often need to be repaired. **************
customer_reviews.author: EK

customer_reviews.title: You won't go wrong with this one!!
customer_reviews.text: This night splint is amazing!! Fits great and very comfortable ... Wasted money on the two strap model.
customer_reviews.author: Arlogger

customer_reviews.title: Product works!
customer_reviews.text: Product works as described. Only problem is the ice pack doesn't do much icing. It's water based and a gel would work much better in my opinion. Overall it's a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Dmann57

customer_reviews.title: Considering the nature of the boot it was pretty comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for me but my foot issue remains undiagnosed. Considering the nature of the boot it was pretty comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kitten

customer_reviews.title: Held together very well. My only complaint would be ...
customer_reviews.text: Held together very well. My only complaint would be that it had a larger wedge. I am now placing a rolled up sock under my foot to get a greater stretch.
customer_reviews.author: Drw8cards

customer_reviews.title: Plantars
customer_reviews.text: It actually works. It's comfortable, make it as tight or loose as you want it. And it does prevent that crazy a.m wake walk!!!
customer_reviews.author: Valarie

customer_reviews.title: Need stronger velcro
customer_reviews.text: The boot works well initially but the 'stick' of the velcro only held up for a 2 1/2-3 months. Anyone familiar with plantar fasciitis knows it's a long term commitment to healing so this boot falls short.
customer_reviews.author: Runbuster

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't seem to get much of a stretch and my ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem to get much of a stretch and my foot gets really hot, the lining needs to be washable therefore.
customer_reviews.author: Britine Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Great night splint, so comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased many night splints and returned them for ill fit and uncomfortable to wear while trying to sleep. This one worked great, comfortable, light weight and the skid proof bottom was an additional plus.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen M Galione

customer_reviews.title: No more plantar fasciatis
customer_reviews.text: After receiving a cortisone shot in my heel, which did absolutely nothing to relieve my pain, I ordered my "boot". I could tell the difference even after wearing it one night, and after about a week I could get up out of bed and feel NO PAIN. I am telling everybody about my "boot". It was the best money I ever spent! Why I chose this product over others was the wedge insert which I started using about the third night. I feel it stretches the tendon (or whatever) even more so it heals better. The boot also has an ice pack insert, but I haven't used that.
customer_reviews.author: polly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I had very good luck with this product and my foot feels much better.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Diegel

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad for the price...
customer_reviews.text: After using this brace for a few months the velcro gets so worn out that it sometimes doesnt stay strapped.
customer_reviews.author: pill fuller

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: The night splint has helped me with foot problems, I used it each night for three weeks and now twice a week, It really helps.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Hurba

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Most helpful item I have purchased for plantar fasciitis. Combination of Velcro and straps hold it in place overnight
customer_reviews.author: Terrie Howarth

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is heavy and runs small. Keeping the velcro tabs closed is problematic. It DOES help the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: This works!
customer_reviews.text: This splint is comfortable enough to allow me to sleep while stretching my achilles. Hooray! Now I can run again!
customer_reviews.author: "Old School" T shirt Queen

customer_reviews.title: Browned Nice Stretch 90 Tension Night Splint
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I purchased this night splint as I was told it would help recede the spur at the side of my heel. Is there any other device that I need to look into to make it more effective? Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Ch'ng Say Eng

customer_reviews.title: PF splints
customer_reviews.text: Works great, no pain in the morning... my foot gets a little toasty in the middle of the night...overall a great thing for stubborn plantar faciitis!
customer_reviews.author: Darci Holland

customer_reviews.title: good night splint, very helpful.
customer_reviews.text: I like the boot, it was comfortable.like the cold pack in bottom of boot. the price works. and I'am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Cabazos

customer_reviews.title: NECESSARY
customer_reviews.text: THE FOOT SPLINT ARRIVED ON TIME AND WORKS WELL, NOT TOO UNCOMFORTABLE AND THE ICE PACK IS A BIG PLUS!
customer_reviews.author: J. Congdon

customer_reviews.title: Used to relieve plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.text: I have been plagued by the pain of plantar fasciitis for about a year. I did exercises but it worsened. I thought I would try a night splint. I wore it every night and after just two weeks I noticed relief. I now only wear it about 4 nights a week. It is not cumbersome and solved my problem. I like that it had an ice pack, which I used in the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia MacAvoy

customer_reviews.title: I needed this
customer_reviews.text: I needed this reallly bad to sleep in. It helped me out alot now I can get out of bed without too much pain.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Hassebrock

customer_reviews.title: plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: This splint does help relieve pain if you wear at night and also do your stretches.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Magic Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I had some doubt while ordering one online. But this shoe did help rest my left foot with Plantar Fasciitis. My right foot started misbehaving last week. I might have to order a second shoe to make them a pair.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hwang

customer_reviews.title: Hard plastic needs to have a soft covering
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad product (it does stay on the foot), but impossible to sleep in because I kept scraping my ankle bone from my other foot across the hard plastic of this splint. They definitely did NOT try this out before they put it on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Cobus

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sretch night splynt
customer_reviews.text: it seems to be the right style well made but it becomes uncomfortable after a few hours, they are all this way.
customer_reviews.author: debra brodsky

customer_reviews.title: So glad I finally purchased
customer_reviews.text: I seriously think this is helping, plus doing yoga. So glad I finally purchased!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Cole

customer_reviews.title: Hoping it does the trick
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to wear at night and the gel pack is a nice addition. Time will tell if it truly helps get rid of plantar fascitis, but so far it seems to be helping!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa K Klug

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, great results
customer_reviews.text: I felt relief after the first night of use and it only improved from there. I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: See a doctor!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product!! Don't waste your money, spend it going to see a doctor!! I saw my foot dr and they said these were a waste of money. I could not sleep with this on. My foot would fall asleep in it and hurt terribly.
customer_reviews.author: Gabbytanner

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing in performance. It provides little, to no, stretch when wearing. Stretching exercises recommended in "The Five Minute Planter Fasciitis Cure" are much more effective. Save your money. Patiently do the stretches, and use orthotic inserts in all your shoes. Avoid moving bare-footed at all times. I now have to figure out what to do with another purchase that does not do what it advertises it will do. Best of recovery to you.
customer_reviews.author: sacredgeo

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made and extremely uncomfortable. Not even worth the inexpensive price.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Better than others... still not perfect!
customer_reviews.text: PROS: *It is very comfortable and more compact than some of the bulkier braces CONS: * It's almost like one person engineered the top and a different person engineered the bottom, and those two people didn't talk to one another! * The buckles are great, but it would be helpful if the boot had a place to stash the excess cord * The foot area is comfortable, but it DOES NOT attach to the actual boot (other than by loose velcro), which allows you foot to flop up and down (somewhat negating the point of the boot) (the reason for the 2-star rating)
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: My foot felt better after the first night
customer_reviews.text: This is unfortunately my second bout with PF (probably from running too many mile), and I lost the old large brace when I moved last. I bought a cheaper "on top of the foot" one, and it hasn't helped in a month. I had ZERO foot pain after the first night of using it, so I'm hoping it will start to heal again. It's large, bulky, and definitely uncomfortable to fall asleep with, but it helps with the pain.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: A Sleep Aid
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why I sleep better but I do! I am inclined to cross my ankles during sleep but this boot prevents me from doing so. No crossing at night, less pain during the day. Keeping my foot in a right angle position at night means less pain at night. This boot has changed my life. Wish I had known about it earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Actually works
customer_reviews.text: I have suffered with plantar fasciitis for almost a year now, at times limping with every step. Even a cortisone shot only helped for a few days (don't do that one-it's agony!!!). The one thing I hadn't tried was a night splint-my podiatrist doesn't "believe in them." Wow! It was easier to get up the first morning and within a few days I felt better throughout the day. I am now well on the road to recovery. Oh, I also "fired" my podiatrist.
customer_reviews.author: S. Grant

customer_reviews.title: I saw that this cast had a complete foot bottom AND a very nice removable bottom cushion that you can freeze/heat and put ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cast because I have a cast with only 1/2 of a hard bottom and it didn't help with my heal. So, I saw that this cast had a complete foot bottom AND a very nice removable bottom cushion that you can freeze/heat and put on the bottom of your foot while wearing the cast. Your foot stays straight, you don't have to worry about it falling out because it is secure with the velcro straps. This was a great purchase and I highly recommend it if you are suffering from Plantar Fascitis.
customer_reviews.author: NYC Legal

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product
customer_reviews.text: After months of prescriptions, stretches, and pain this made a huge difference after 4 nights of use. Lower and thinner that the other splints I tried. Much more comfortable. The only drawback is the upper strap is not quite long enough if you have large calves. It has another strap that goes over that one with plenty of adjustment room. It is still comfortable enough for me and I'm not a sound sleeper. Attached is the proper photo.
customer_reviews.author: Nik

product_meta.title: Nice Stretch 90 Patented Plantar Fasciitis Night Splint with Cold Therapy and Non-Skid Sole, Large/XL
feature_bullets: FUNCTIONAL DESIGN. The Nice Stretch 90º is a night splint that can be used to support plantar fasciitis, Achilles tendonitis, and plantar flexion contractures.
ALL-NIGHT SUPPORT. With its fixed angle design, non-skid treads, and Polar Ice inserts for under the toes, the Nice Stretch 90º provides an improved treatment protocol for patients.
LOW PROFILE. This heavy-duty, rigid night splint for plantar fasciitis will not bend or flex, helping to keep the heel firmly in place while sleeping.
KEEPS FOOT AT 90º. The Nice Stretch 90º night splint stretches the foot by keeping it at a right angle.
PATENTED PRODUCT. This plantar fasciitis night splint is designed with passive stretch capability and cold therapy in mind to offer consistent support overnight.
